wait.fact: This is Mercury. It is the closest planet to the sun.
wait.question: Click on Mercury

wait.fact: This is Venus. It is the 2nd planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Venus

wait.fact: This is Earth. We are the 3rd planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Earth

wait.fact: This is Mars. It is the 4th planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Mars

wait.fact: This is Jupiter. It is the 5th planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Jupiter

wait.fact: This is Saturn. It is the 6th planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Saturn

wait.fact: This is Uranus. It is the 7th planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Uranus

wait.fact: This is Neptune. It is the 8th (and furthest) planet from the sun.
wait.question: Click on Neptune

wait.fact: Earth is the only planet with life on it (that we know of).
wait.question: Which planet has life (that we know of)?

wait.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, and Jupiter have no rings.
wait.question: Which planets have no rings?

wait.fact: Saturn has the brightest rings
wait.question: Which planet has the brightest rings?

wait.fact: Uranus and Neptune have rings, but they are dim.
wait.question: Which planet has dim rings?

wait.fact: Mercury and Venus have no moons.
wait.question: Which planet has no moons?

wait.fact: Mercury has no atmosphere (air).
wait.question: Which planet has no atmosphere?

wait.fact: Jupiter is the biggest planet in our solar system.
wait.question: What is the biggest planet in out solar system?

wait.fact: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system.
wait.question: What is the smallest planet in out solar system?

wait.fact: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune are known as gas giants because they are made of gas.
wait.question: Which planets are gas giants?

wait.fact: Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars have solid surfaces (they are "terrestrial").
wait.question: Which planets have a solid surface (terrestrial)?

wait.fact: Mercury, Earth and Mars have molten metal cores.
wait.question: Which planet has a molten metal core?

wait.fact: Uranus and Neptune are known as ice giants because there cores are made of ice
wait.question: Which planet is an ice giant (has an ice core)?

wait.fact: Venus and Uranus spin backwards. The sun rises in the west, and sets in the east.
wait.question: Which planet spins backwards?

wait.fact: Uranus rotates on its side.
wait.question: Which planet rotates sideways?

wait.fact: Neptune is the windiest planet, where wind speeds can reach 2,000 kilometers per hour.
wait.question: What is the windiest planet?

wait.fact: Mars is red because iron mineral on the surface are rusting (oxidizing).
wait.question: Which planet gets its color from iron minerals rusting (oxidizing)?

wait.fact: Mars has two moons called Phobos and Deimos.
wait.question: Which planet has two moons called Phobos and Deimos?

wait.fact: The red spot on Jupiter is a giant storm.
wait.question: Which planet has a red spot that is a giant storm?

wait.fact: Juptier has 67 known moons, the most out of all the planets.
wait.question: Which planet has 67 moons?

wait.fact: Saturn has 62 moons.
wait.question: Which planet has 62 moons?

wait.fact: The gas giants (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of hydrogen and helium gas.
wait.question: Which planet is made of mostly hydrogen and helium?

wait.fact: The ice giants (Uranus and Neptune) are mostly made of water, ammonia and methane.
wait.question: Which gas planet is also made of water, ammonia and methane?
